skill.name: datamol
skill.description: Pythonic wrapper around RDKit with simplified interface and sensible defaults. Preferred for standard drug discovery: SMILES parsing, standardization, descriptors, fingerprints, clustering, 3D conformers, parallel processing. Returns native rdkit.Chem.Mol objects. For advanced control or custom parameters, use rdkit directly.

security_audit.summary: All files are documentation with examples and no executable tooling. No credential access, network exfiltration, or code execution patterns were found.

content.value_statement: Cheminformatics workflows are slow when RDKit APIs are complex. This skill gives concise, reliable patterns for common molecular tasks.
actual_capabilities: Parse and standardize SMILES into RDKit molecule objects
Read and write SDF, SMILES, CSV, and Excel molecular datasets
Compute molecular descriptors in batch with parallel jobs
Generate fingerprints and compute similarity or clustering
Create and analyze 3D conformers with RMSD and SASA
limitations: Requires datamol and RDKit to be installed in the runtime environment
Butina clustering is suitable for small sets due to full distance matrix use
Reaction outcomes depend on valid SMARTS reaction definitions
Remote file access needs proper fsspec backend libraries

use_cases.title: Standardize compound libraries
use_cases.description: Clean and standardize SMILES before descriptor calculation and screening.

use_cases.title: Build features for ML
use_cases.description: Generate fingerprints or descriptors for model training and validation.

use_cases.title: Create SAR visuals
use_cases.description: Render aligned molecule grids with activity labels for SAR reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Parse SMILES
prompt_templates.scenario: Convert SMILES to molecules and filter invalids
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this SMILES list to molecules, drop invalid entries, and return canonical SMILES.

prompt_templates.title: Compute descriptors
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute standard descriptors for these molecules with parallel jobs and report the top five by molecular weight.

prompt_templates.title: Cluster library
prompt_templates.prompt: Cluster this molecule list with Butina at cutoff 0.2 and summarize cluster sizes.

prompt_templates.title: Generate conformers
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate 25 conformers per molecule, compute SASA, and report min and max SASA values.

output_examples.input: Standardize these SMILES and compute basic descriptors
output: Parsed 120 SMILES and kept 115 valid molecules
Standardized molecules with metal disconnection and reionization
Computed MW, LogP, HBD, HBA, and TPSA for each molecule

best_practices: Standardize molecules before analysis or model training
Use parallel jobs for batch descriptor and similarity work
Align molecules when comparing SAR series in visual grids
anti_patterns: Run Butina clustering on very large libraries without sampling
Skip validation for None molecules after parsing SMILES
Use toy datasets for production model conclusions

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is platform neutral and works with those assistants.

faq.question: What are the scale limits for clustering?
faq.answer: Butina clustering is best under about 1,000 molecules due to distance matrix size.

faq.question: Can it integrate with cloud storage?
faq.answer: Yes, through fsspec paths for S3, GCS, Azure, and HTTP sources.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is documentation only and does not fetch credentials.

faq.question: What if SMILES parsing fails?
faq.answer: Use standardize_smiles or fix_mol and filter None entries after parsing.

faq.question: How does it compare to using RDKit directly?
faq.answer: It provides simpler defaults and helpers while returning native RDKit molecules.
